pesticide.PPE: long-sleeved shirt and long pants; shoes plus socks; chemical-resistant gloves, except when sewing bags of treated seed; protective eyewear (goggles, face shield, or safety glasses); chemical-resistant apron when loading, cleaning up spills, or cleaning equipment; NIOSH approved dust mist filtering respirator with MSHA/NIOSH approval number prefix TC-21C or a NIOSH-approved respirator with any N2, R, P or HE filter.

Safety_Information.if_In_Eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15 - 20 minutes. Remove contact lens, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have the person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15 - 20 minutes. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably mouth-to-mouth if possible. Call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Probable mucosal damage may contraindicate the use of gastric lavage.

Application_Info.application_Method: planter-box treatment (including air and vacuum planters)

Target_Disease_Pest.name: covered smut (Tilletia caries and Tilletia foetida)

Application_Info.application_Method: planter-box treatment (including air and vacuum planters)

Target_Disease_Pest.name: seedling blights (including Fusarium, Rhizoctonia and Pythium)
